1.text: A good name is more desirable than great riches, and loving favor is better than silver and gold.

2.text: The rich and the poor have this in common: Yahweh is the maker of them all.

3.text: A prudent man sees danger, and hides himself; but the simple pass on, and suffer for it.

4.text: The result of humility and the fear of Yahweh is wealth, honor, and life.

5.text: Thorns and snares are in the path of the wicked: whoever guards his soul stays from them.

6.text: Train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.

7.text: The rich rule over the poor. The borrower is servant to the lender.

8.text: He who sows wickedness reaps trouble, and the rod of his fury will be destroyed.

9.text: He who has a generous eye will be blessed; for he shares his food with the poor.

10.text: Drive out the mocker, and strife will go out; yes, quarrels and insults will stop.

11.text: He who loves purity of heart and speaks gracefully is the king’s friend.

12.text: The eyes of Yahweh watch over knowledge; but he frustrates the words of the unfaithful.

13.text: The sluggard says, “There is a lion outside! I will be killed in the streets!”

14.text: The mouth of an adulteress is a deep pit: he who is under Yahweh’s wrath will fall into it.

15.text: Folly is bound up in the heart of a child: the rod of discipline drives it far from him.

16.text: Whoever oppresses the poor for his own increase and whoever gives to the rich, both come to poverty.

17.text: Turn your ear, and listen to the words of the wise. Apply your heart to my teaching.

18.text: For it is a pleasant thing if you keep them within you, if all of them are ready on your lips.

19.text: That your trust may be in Yahweh, I teach you today, even you.

20.text: Haven’t I written to you thirty excellent things of counsel and knowledge,

21.text: To teach you truth, reliable words, to give sound answers to the ones who sent you?

22.text: Don’t exploit the poor, because he is poor; and don’t crush the needy in court;

23.text: for Yahweh will plead their case, and plunder the life of those who plunder them.

24.text: Don’t befriend a hot-tempered man, and don’t associate with one who harbors anger:

25.text: lest you learn his ways, and ensnare your soul.

26.text: Don’t you be one of those who strike hands, of those who are collateral for debts.

27.text: If you don’t have means to pay, why should he take away your bed from under you?

28.text: Don’t move the ancient boundary stone, which your fathers have set up.

29.text: Do you see a man skilled in his work? He will serve kings. He won’t serve obscure men.
